abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Fifth
            Telecommunications Project for Pakistan was highly
            satisfactory. The project achieved its main objectives, its
            impact on institutional development was rated as high,
            sustainability is likely, and the performance of both the
            Bank and Borrower was fully satisfactory. Several lessons
            can be learned from this project. First, the conversion of a
            government department into a corporation takes more work and
            time than generally expected. Second, a higher degree of
            financial and operational autonomy will lead to more
            efficient operations. This will be reflected in the
            performance indicators for satisfaction of demand, service
            quality, and operational efficiency. Third, technical
            assistance to maintain proper project cost accounts,
            especially for local costs, should be provided under the
            project to enable adequate cost benefit analysis. Finally,
            PTC's corporatization and the Bank's dialogue with
            GOP in this matter further accelerated sector restructuring,
            e.g. market liberalization (private cellular operators,
            etc.) and, more recently, the privatization of PTC.
